Use the button below to create a sample settings file in your home directory and have it loaded in your preferred text editor.
After you have added rules for your applications, use the 'hamburger' menu (☰) to import the settings file.

If you are modifying existing settings, use the 'hamburger' menu to export the current settings, then make your modifications and re-import.

── Available Settings Keys ──
• wmClass (string, required) - Window class to match (e.g., "Firefox"). Use xprop WM_CLASS to find it.
• matchField (string, optional) - Match by "wmClass" (default) or "title" for window title matching.
• workspace (integer, optional) - 0-based workspace index to move the window to.
• x, y (integer, optional) - Top-left coordinates where the window should be placed.
• width, height (integer, optional) - Desired width/height in pixels.
• maximized (boolean, optional) - If true, window will be fully maximized. Overrides position/size.
• maximizeVertically (boolean, optional) - If true, window will be maximized vertically only. Requires width to be specified.
• firstOnly (boolean, optional) - If true, only the first instance of the app is affected; subsequent windows are ignored until it closes.
